data: ORTHO Elective Lower Extremity - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue ORTHO Elective - Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Patient to follow primary or revision pathways as specified (foot and ankle, fractured hip, hip and knee arthroplasty)
once, baseline on admission, then q2h for 12 hour; then q4h for 36 hour; then q12h for 48 hour and PRN
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
For compartment syndrome with pain q1h for 12 hour; then q2h for 12 hour. Increase frequency of monitoring as required
For compartment syndrome with pain q2h for 12 hour; then q4h for 36 hour; then PRN only. Increase frequency of monitoring as required
For compartment syndrome with pain q2h for 12 hour; then q4h for 36 hour; then q12h for 48hour; then PRN only. Increase frequency of monitoring as required
Once baseline on admission, then q2h for 12 hours, then q4h for 36 hours, then q12h for 48 hours and PRN
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
Site: Surgical incision(s), No dressing change; reinforce as needed
Site: Surgical incision(s), Reinforce PRN, change dressing on day of discharge
Site: Surgical incision, Change dressing post-op day 1, then PRN only if saturated
Site: Surgical incision, Change dressing post-op day 2, then PRN only if saturated

Site: Surgical incision(s), For Mepilex Border dressing, do not remove until staples/sutures are discontinued. If dressing is moderately saturated, remove and replace with another Mepilex Border dressing. Do not clean wound
If uncontrolled or persistent pain, and notify physician
PRN, for 15 minutes on affected limb. Ensure barrier between skin and ice
T+10;0800, Remove sutures post-op day 10 to 14 if edges of wound well approximated
T+10;0800, Remove sutures post-op day 10 to 14 if edges of wound well approximated
No suction for 4 hour, then activate suction
When drainage less than 30 mL in 8 hours

Avoid catheter unless one or more indicators met:    - Retention not relieved by 2 in and out catheters   - Critically ill-accurate output required   - Advanced pressure ulcer & incontinent   - End of life comfort   - Severe pain unrelieved with analgesics
If no catheter in situ or post catheter removal assess patient for ability to void q6h using bladder scanner
If unable to void, bladder discomfort or voiding small amounts, bladder scan
If PVR greater than 300 mL, perform straight intermittent catheterization x 3 PRN. If third catheterization is required, notify MD / NP
If urine output less than 150 mL in 6 hours
Overhead lift contraindicated for the following: pelvic and acetabular fractures, or spinal fractures
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 75 kg
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 50 kg
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 20 kg
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 75 kg
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 50 kg
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 20 kg
Do NOT place a pillow under the knee
Elevate affected foot/ankle 6 inches above heart 22 of 24 hours
For Hip Arthroplasty Patients, maintain hip precautions for 3 months
No hip flexion above 90 degrees, 6, week
No hip flexion above 90 degrees, 2, week
No hip flexion above 90 degrees, 12, week
No post-op antibiotics (as per Regional Surgical Antibiotic Prophylaxis Guidelines)

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, select vancomycin
1,000 mg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute
1,500 mg, IV, once, administer over: 90 minute
40 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
150 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab

RENAL PROTECTION for prostalac stage 1 procedures   Hold Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor (e.g. ramipril, trandoloapril, caPTOPRil, enalapril, perindopril, quinAPRIL) and Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (e.g. losartan, candesartan, irbesartan, olmesartan, valsartan). Pharmacist / MD to assess reinitiation of Angiotensin Receptor Blocker / Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor after 72 hours
20 mg, PO, q6h, PRN hypertension, drug form: tab
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, q2day, drug form: tab, start: T+2;2000
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, qdaily, drug form: tab,  T+2;2000
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, BID, drug form: tab, start: T+2;1400
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
Ensure discharge information and prescription given to patient
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 2 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 1 week
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 3 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 4 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 6 weeks
Patient to make appointment with family physician in 1 week
Patient to make appointment with family physician in 2 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with family physician in 7-10 days
Once baseline on admission, then q4h for 24 hour, then QID
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
Once baseline on admission, then q2h for 12 hour, then q4h for 36 hour, then q12h for 48 hour and PRN
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Convert IV to saline lock when oral intake adequate (1200 to 1500 mL/24 h unless fluid restricted)
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 2 day
If platelets LESS than 100 x 10^9/L, OR hemoglobin drops by 20 g/L or more OR if hemoglobin less than 80 g/L OR hemoglobin less than 90 g/L for patients with a history of cardiac illness
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 2 day
